intro: Pleroma melanocalyx, commonly known as the black-flowered pleroma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its striking dark purple to black flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and woody. Pleroma melanocalyx is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique coloration.
